feed.title: On the scalability issues of onboarding millions of LN mobile clients

entry.title: On the scalability issues of onboarding millions of LN mobile clients
entry.summary: The discussion in the email revolves around making the user experience of connecting a mobile Lightning Network client to a home full node easier. This is important because it reduces the reliance on centralized services. A solution for this already exists in QuickConnect, an emerging approach that allows for secure connection via Tor v3 from a remote to your own personal full node. It is currently offered by various tools and hardware such as BitcoinStandup, BTCPayServer, Nodl, MyNode, RaspiBlitz full node, and used by apps such as FullyNoded and FullyNoded2. However, QuickConnect still needs another major iteration, and contributions to requirements and proposals for the next version are welcome. The invite to share thoughts is directed to the GitHub page provided in the email.
